content.description:
IMAGE 1: SAINT LAWRENCE RIVER VALLEY, QUEBEC, CANADA

IMAGE 2: VALE OF THE WHITE HORSE, OXFORDSHIRE, UNITED KINGDOM

Source: Esri Data Partners

The remotely sensed images show the outcomes of different rural land survey methods.
content.question:
A. Describe ONE difference between the land survey methods that resulted in the spatial patterns shown in Image 1 and Image 2.

B. Describe a disadvantage of the land survey method used in Oxfordshire.

C. Explain how the land survey method shown in Image 1 may reflect ideas about social equality.

D. Explain how localized intensive agricultural practices may affect bodies of surface water in the St. Lawrence River valley.

E. Explain ONE advantage of changing the scale of these images to 1:1,000 for interpreting rural land use patterns.

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Explain how maps, images, and landscapes illustrate, or relate to geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
